newsitem.title: USA: Seabrook, N.H., nuke plant seen fully back July 3.
newsitem.headline: Seabrook, N.H., nuke plant seen fully back July 3.

text.p: The 1,164-megawatt (MW) nuclear power plant in Seabrook, New Hampshire, is expected to achieve full output Thursday after being restarted last Friday, the operator, North Atlantic Energy Service Corp, said Monday.
"We're hoping to be at 100 percent by July 3," a North Atlantic Energy spokesman said.
At 1330 EDT/1730 GMT Monday, the Seabrook station was sending 424 MW of electricity to the regional grid after reconnecting to the grid Saturday, the spokesman said.
Seabrook was shut May 9 for planned refueling and maintenance.
Northeast Utilities is the majority owner of Seabrook with a 39.6 percent stake. Other Seabrook owners include New England Electric System, United Illuminating Co and Eastern Utilities Associates.
